name: Lemon-Garlic Basa with Roasted Green Beans and Fluffy Couscous
description: Light, mild fish with a quick lemon-garlic pan sauce, roasted green beans, and fluffy couscous. Family-friendly and ready in under 30 minutes.
prep_steps: Rinse and trim the ends of the green beans.
Zest then juice the lemon; keep separately.
Pat the basa dry and season both sides with salt and pepper.
cook_steps: Roast beans: Toss green beans with 1 tbsp olive oil, a pinch of salt, and pepper on a baking tray. Roast 12–15 minutes until tender and lightly charred.
Heat stock: Bring vegetable stock to a boil in a small pot.
Make couscous: Place couscous in a heatproof bowl. Pour the hot vegetable stock over, cover, and let sit 5 minutes. Fluff with a fork, then mix in 1 tbsp butter and half the parsley.
Cook fish: Heat 1 tbsp olive oil in a large nonstick skillet over medium-high. Add basa and cook 3–4 minutes per side until opaque and flakes easily.

Finish sauce: Reduce heat to medium-low. Add remaining 1 tbsp butter and the minced garlic to the pan; cook 30 seconds until fragrant. Stir in lemon juice and a pinch of salt; spoon sauce over the fish.
Serve: Plate couscous, top with basa and pan sauce. Add roasted green beans on the side. Sprinkle lemon zest and remaining parsley over the top.
